annotation.spannedText: this is enough to keep the immune response of my healthy animals adequate

classMention.mentionClass: this is enough to keep the immune response of my healthy animals adequate

annotation.spannedText: I recommend they at least get titers checked

classMention.mentionClass: I recommend they at least get titers checked

annotation.spannedText: I don't think we need to vaccinate all the time, especially indoor cats that aren't out there exploring the world of disease

classMention.mentionClass: I don't think we need to vaccinate all the time, especially indoor cats that aren't out there exploring the world of disease

annotation.spannedText: There's pretty good evidence that the core vaccines confer immunity for a very long time, possibly for life

classMention.mentionClass: There's pretty good evidence that the core vaccines confer immunity for a very long time, possibly for life

annotation.spannedText: vaccines cause more problems than just acute reactions or cancer

classMention.mentionClass: vaccines cause more problems than just acute reactions or cancer

annotation.spannedText: I'd recommend basic vaccinations

classMention.mentionClass: I'd recommend basic vaccinations

annotation.spannedText: the risk of exposure is still more important than the minimal risks you take when you vaccinate a cat

classMention.mentionClass: the risk of exposure is still more important than the minimal risks you take when you vaccinate a cat

annotation.spannedText: You can't keep your cat in a perfect bubble

classMention.mentionClass: You can't keep your cat in a perfect bubble

annotation.spannedText: Trying to vaccinate against everything might not make sense if the cat is an indoor-only cat,

classMention.mentionClass: Trying to vaccinate against everything might not make sense if the cat is an indoor-only cat,

annotation.spannedText: Go for the kitten shots at least--basic defenses against major cat diseases

classMention.mentionClass: Go for the kitten shots at least--basic defenses against major cat diseases

annotation.spannedText: If your cat's indoor-only and you don't foster or board the cat anywhere, that's probably enough

classMention.mentionClass: If your cat's indoor-only and you don't foster or board the cat anywhere, that's probably enough

annotation.spannedText: Usually it's safer to vaccinate

classMention.mentionClass: Usually it's safer to vaccinate

annotation.spannedText: pets are over vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: pets are over vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: some of the other vaccinations do not seem necessary for low risk pets, especially indoor only

classMention.mentionClass: some of the other vaccinations do not seem necessary for low risk pets, especially indoor only

annotation.spannedText: There's no reason to think the immune system of animals functions any differently

classMention.mentionClass: There's no reason to think the immune system of animals functions any differently

annotation.spannedText: This vigilance in humans indicates that immunity induced by vaccination in humans is extremely long lasting and, in most cases, life-long

annotation.spannedText: Canine Vaccine Guidelines

classMention.mentionClass: Canine Vaccine Guidelines

annotation.spannedText: This strongly suggests that, like the human rabies vaccine, the canine rabies vaccine may provide life-long immunity as well

classMention.mentionClass: This strongly suggests that, like the human rabies vaccine, the canine rabies vaccine may provide life-long immunity as well

annotation.spannedText: all of these are diseases of young animals; most older animals are naturally resistant

annotation.spannedText: Once vaccinated, adult animals are typically fully immune

classMention.mentionClass: Once vaccinated, adult animals are typically fully immune

annotation.spannedText: If you rescue or foster, having a "quarantine room" is a necessary precaution

classMention.mentionClass: If you rescue or foster, having a "quarantine room" is a necessary precaution

annotation.spannedText: those rescue/foster animals shouldn't be introduced to your cats until they've seen a vet, been vaccinated, and several weeks have passed to ensure no illness flares up, even if they do not appear sick
